intro: Leandra fragilis, commonly known as the delicate leandra, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Leandra fragilis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
